Post-Match Reflections: Will Hardy emphasized the importance of valuing every minute on the floor and not taking it for granted.
Hardy mentioned that the Jazz are starting to feel cohesion as a group, but still have a long way to go.
The Jazz are 2-6 in their last 8 games, which is progress without hurting their draft position.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Jazz are 14th in offensive rating and 16th in defensive rating since Dec. 26, which is an improvement from their season average.
The Heat shot 28% from three and under 40% from two, which is a testament to the Jazz's defensive effort.
Johnny Juzang is shooting 40% from three this year and taking almost four times as many threes as twos, which is a key part of his development.
Others: The Jazz's loss to the Heat was their fourth by five points or fewer since Christmas.
Isaiah Collier played 33 minutes and finished the game, while Cody Williams played 23 minutes and finished the game on Tuesday.
Kyle Filipowski played 23 minutes and had critical minutes down the stretch, and all three rookies have been getting more opportunities with the main team.
